page.title: 18Local History - Early Times
page.content: Denny and Dunipace are situated in Central Region, the most historic part of Scotland. Dunipace appears to have more historical association than Denny. In Roman times, the{Antonine {Wall}was 4 or 5 kilometres South and the Celts in our area were very fierce. Legend tells us that the Romans made a peace treaty with the local tribes and to commemorate it 2 hills were built which are still there and are called the Hills of Dunipace. Even the name is part Gaelic and part Latin, Dun=Hill, Pace=Peace. Years later, the Gaelic poet,{Ossian,}wrote of combats between great Celtic heroes on the banks of the River Carron. Picts and Scots also fought nearby. The 8th century{Dunipace Brooch,}now in a museum in Edinburgh, reminds us of the artistic qualities of our Celtic past.
